definition: soul/spirit/immortal soul, i.e. that can be detached from the body

sentences.english: We found people wandering like ghosts through the ruins .
sentences.chinese: 孤魂野鬼一样的人们在废墟里游荡。

sentences.english: My love will not make me be a forever sole soul even in the darkest palace.
sentences.chinese: 我的爱，也不会让我成为永久的孤魂。

sentences.english: We found people wandering like ghosts through the ruins.
sentences.chinese: 我们找到孤魂野鬼一样的人们在废墟里游荡。

sentences.english: I just wanted to be a ghost, completely anonymous.
sentences.chinese: 我只想像一个孤魂一样，完完全全地隐姓埋名。

sentences.english: Her voice was sharp and bitter, like the cry of a lost soul in the wintry night.
sentences.chinese: 她的声音尖锐而痛苦，仿佛冬夜里的孤魂野鬼在嚎叫。

sentences.english: But I likely am a fox soul wild ghost.
sentences.chinese: 而我就像是一个孤魂野鬼。

definition: ghost of one who died unjustly/departed spirit demanding vengeance for grievances
to surpass/to transcend/to perform religious ceremonies to help the soul find peace
